text: I'm Trish gray
I am the head of capacity engineering
and Cloud architecture at Pinterest
within the infrastructure as a routine
capacity engineering and Cloud
architecture it runs a very wide scope
across Pinterest on capacity engineering
we deal with capacity planning and
management
cost attribution and Reporting and
um profiling and optimization on the
cloud architecture side we're dealing
with Disaster Recovery we're dealing
with availability to its own resilience
we're working on multi-account we were
born on AWS and we grew a lot and very
fast and you know Pinterest being a
startup we grew fast without being able
to go back and and figure things out
right in real time so so now you know
we're dealing with the tech debt of that
as we're a bit larger when you're
dealing with you know 450 million
monthly active users and all the content
that comes along with that and the
expectations that come along with that
you know it's Mission critical to have
that data backed up proserve came in to
look at our special needs because I mean
there are buckets there's virgining for
buckets you know that is baked into AWS
but at our scale we needed something
finer grained than that they came up
with an ingenious solution which we call
penis recopy
that copies terabytes of data at the
prefix level in minutes as opposed to
hours days weeks if there hadn't been a
penis with copy tool if there hadn't
been a version recovery tool
um could have taken weeks to get this
data back so we're very happy because
everyone just kind of slept right
through it
and and didn't have to be paged at all
[Music]
